title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 08 May 2013 - XWiki
content:
<sdumitriu1> has quit  
00:40 <abusenius> has quit  
01:06 <Denis> has quit  
01:09 <sdumitriu> has quit  
02:13 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
04:30 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
05:34 <altker128> has left #xwiki  
05:51 <Denis> has quit  
06:44 <altker128> has joined #xwiki  
06:45 <altker128> Hi all.  I'm trying to get XWiki to run on FBSD9.1 w/tomcat7/openjdk7/postgres9.013 .  I've followed the guide listed here (http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Drafts/BSD\_Install) but when I put in the IP address of xwiki server, nothing comes up.  I'm new to tomcat, any pointers on where to look?  
06:54 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
07:39 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
08:01 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:18 <altker128> I was just setting up XWiki and it crashed during indexing due to heap errors.  Is there an easy way to re-start the initial logon procedure?  
08:26 <vmassol> altker128: give more memory to the JVM (see recommended values on xwiki.org), restart and reindex (admin page)  
08:32 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
08:33 <altker128> vmassol: I did allocate more memory but I can't find the admin page  
08:34 <vmassol> check your top level menus  
08:34 <vmassol> be sure to be logged in with an admin user too  
08:34 <altker128> vmassol: I didn't even get far enough to create such a user  
08:34 <altker128> vmassol: It crashed while doing the very initial setup  
08:35 <vmassol> what setup?  
08:35 <altker128> vmassol: Well, when you first run xwiki via the webgui  
08:35 <vmassol> Distribution Wizard?  
08:35 <altker128> vmassol: I think so  
08:35 <vmassol> well the DW restarts by itself to continue where it left off  
08:35 <vmassol> normally  
08:35 <vmassol> what do you see when you restart xwiki?  
08:37 <altker128> vmassol: checking  
08:37 <altker128> vmassol: It feels hung  
08:37 <vmassol> nothing is displayed?  
08:38 <vmassol> blank screen?  
08:38 <altker128> vmassol: It feels like tomcat died, nothing is coming up on ip:8080 .  I may just switch over to Debain from FreeBSD and start with the .DEBs  
08:38 <vmassol> but you said you restarted t  
08:38 <vmassol> it cannot die  
08:39 <vmassol> either you restarted it or you didn't  
08:39 <vmassol> you can check tomcat logs too  
08:39 <vmassol> or you just pick the xwiki standalone distribution  
08:39 <vmassol> and you're done in less than 1 minute  
08:40 <altker128> vmassol: XWiki standalone == does not need tomcat?  
08:40 <vmassol> it uses jetty  
08:40 <vmassol> all packaged in the zip  
08:40 <vmassol> jetty + hsqldb  
08:40 <altker128> vmassol: Is there any "real" disadvantage to that approach?  
08:40 <vmassol> altker128: please check the web site  
08:40 <altker128> hrm...hsqldb I think will chug as more gets added  
08:40 <vmassol> all this is documented  
08:40 <altker128> yeah  
08:40 <vmassol> I have no idea what you're doing  
08:41 <altker128> vmassol: Just setting up a personal wiki  
08:41 <vmassol> I was jsut answering initially to a question about stuck indexing  
08:41 <altker128> vmassol: I like XWiki because of all the useful plugins  
08:41 <vmassol> :)  
08:41 <altker128> vmassol: No problem  
08:42 <vmassol> I'll have to go soon (I'm on holidays today ;))  
08:42 <altker128> vmassol: OK, no problem.  I'll try to re-index, if not I may seriously dump the FreeBSD setup  
08:42 <vmassol> why do you keep talking about some indexing?  
08:43 <altker128> vmassol: Sorry  
08:43 <vmassol> the only indexing that exists is the lucene indexing but from what you say that's not your issue at all here  
08:43 <altker128> At this point, no evreything has stopped responding  
08:43 <altker128> but I'll tackle it one problem at a time.  
08:44 <vmassol> just verify your tomcat logs  
08:48 <altker128> vmassol: I have it re-running.  I have Wiki, Space, Page , at the top right, Register, Log-in, Apps: Blog, Dashboard  
08:48 <vmassol> sounds good  
08:49 <altker128> vmassol: How to pick it up where things got left off?  
08:49 <vmassol> if you see what you described it means all is finished  
08:50 <vmassol> do you have anything not working? :)  
08:50 <altker128> Well, if I want to do administrative tasks, do I need to create those entries in the database, or is the password default?  I thought maybe the "wizard" that runs on the first-run would help me figure that stuff out  
08:52 <vmassol> altker128: I have no idea what you chose to do in the Distributino Wizard  
08:52 <vmassol> if you followed the normal process you'll have an Admin user created  
09:09 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
09:37 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
10:08 <sburjan> good morning. vmassol , mflorea : I have a question about DW. I want to upgrade my myxwiki.org instance to 5.0.1. I am asked if this is a new install or an upgrade. I select upgrade, and I have to choose the previous version which was installed. The problem that the latest version I have in the dropdown is 4.2-M2, nothing newer like 4.3, 4.4, 4.5 or 5.0. Is this normal ?  
10:11 <mflorea> yes, select the latest then modify it  
10:12 <sburjan> mflorea: ok, so I click the pencil icon and put 5.0 for example instead of 4.2-milestone-2, leaving the artefactId unchanged ?  
10:12 <mflorea> put whatever version you have currently installed  
10:12 <sburjan> ok  
10:12 <sburjan> any hint on how can I see which UI version do I have installed ? :)  
10:13 <evalica> what maybe is confusing is the label "Previous Version" maybe it should be called "Previous Version of the User Interface" (although is kind of long)  
10:13 <mflorea> you should know it  
10:13 <evalica> although is in the "User Interface" section  
10:13 <mflorea> evalica: yes, you're inside the User Interface section  
10:14 <sburjan> no no, I am not confusing it. Problem is that users might forget. For example, I did :)  
10:14 <evalica> first time I thought it asked the previous farm version  
10:14 <evalica> and I wanted to put 4.5.3  
10:15 <sburjan> because users usually when they hear upgrade they imagine that the system knows already it's version, thus migrates tot the latest. IMO this is a thing users shouldn't care/know.  
10:16 <evalica> the thing is that this is supposed to be done by admins … but for normal users is confusing  
10:16 <sburjan> in my case it's blocking because I don't know what to choose :)  
10:16 <sburjan> nad I am an admin (of my subwiki)  
10:16 <sburjan> \*and  
10:16 <evalica> I never upgraded or touched incubator …. I never installed anything on it :) I selected the closest in that select  
10:24 <sburjan> great, I get Skol during migration on myxwiki.org  
10:26 <evalica> at least we cover also this use case and see what bugs we get  
10:37 <vmassol> sburjan: please report all issues you have  
10:37 <vmassol> you shouldn't need to ask any question  
10:37 <vmassol> if you need then it means it fails the standard user test :)  
10:37 <sburjan> yes it kinda of does :(  
10:37 <sburjan> ok, I'll report them. But I;m sure they will be closed as invalid  
10:38 <evalica> again: we should really decide what our target is: normal users or admins  
10:38 <vmassol> re the version of your existing UI nobody knows on myxwiki.org  
10:38 <vmassol> evalica: admins  
10:38 <vmassol> but admins are normal users  
10:38 <sburjan> but I am an admin and I don';t know my previous version  
10:38 <vmassol> especially on myxwiki.org  
10:38 <vmassol> exactly  
10:38 <sburjan> you should know it since you created the wiki :)  
10:38 <vmassol> nobody knows what's on myxwiki.org for 2 reasons  
10:39 <vmassol> - someone installed the first UI for them based on a myxwiki template  
10:39 <vmassol> - or they updated some part of the UI when it broke a long time ago (as it happened to me for massol.myxwiki.org and thus you don't remember what you had before)  
10:39 <vmassol> sburjan: you mean the sorin2 wiki?  
10:40 <sburjan> vmassol: yes, I am still struggling to upgrade it, but running into different sort of issues :)  
10:40 <vmassol> cool  
10:41 <vmassol> btw i'm on holidays today, leaving soon :)  
10:43 <altker128> I noticed with XWiki + tomcat7, page loads felt slow (server is a Quad-Core-i7 machine with 8GB of RAM).  Are there any reasonable tips to make XWiki more responsive in addition to the RAM tuning?  
10:43 <sburjan> vmassol, only today ? :)  
10:53 <sburjan> vmassol: can you delete sorin2 and re-create it in the same way you did yesterday ? I have to start over the migration. If it fails again, I'll repport an issue  
11:03 <sburjan\_> has joined #xwiki

20:53 <altker128> For those using xwiki , have you ever had to migrate your data?  Is it as simple as backing up the database and restoring it?  
21:08 <Denis> has quit  
21:44 <Inge->  you can export it and import it, or back it upband restorebit.  
21:44 <Inge-> restore it\*  
21:45 <Inge-> I've done both, and pretty much, yeah.  
23:13 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
23:17 <vmassol> has quit  
23:53 <sdumitriu1> has quit
